alert.note: Alert for Allegany; Cattaraugus; Chautauqua; Livingston (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 02 at 10:28PM EST until February 02 at 10:45PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EST FOR SOUTHERN CATTARAUGUS...SOUTH CENTRAL LIVINGSTON...SOUTHEASTERN CHAUTAUQUA AND ALLEGANY COUNTIES... At 1027 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Bluff Point to near Warren, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 390 near exit 4. Interstate 86 between exits 18 and 33. Locations impacted include... Olean, Salamanca, Dansville, Wellsville, Allegany State Park, Alfred, Allegany, Belfast, Cuba and Weston Mills. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
